snippet: The prime minister has vowed to repeal a controversial sorcery act after the latest in a string of brutal public killings of people accused of practicing black magic.
abstract: Papua New Guinea’s Prime Min Peter O’Neill vows to repeal country’s controversial Sorcery Act after latest in string of brutal public killings of people accused of practicing black magic; Amnesty International finds violence against those accused of sorcery is endemic in the South Pacific island nation.
lead_paragraph: The prime minister has vowed to repeal a controversial sorcery act after the latest in a string of brutal public killings of people accused of practicing black magic.

headline.seo: Papua New Guinea Considers Repealing Sorcery Law
headline.main: Papua New Guinea Considers Repealing Sorcery Law
headline.print_headline:
Papua New Guinea: Prime Minister
Says He Wants to Repeal Sorcery Law
